title: (x) swirly 80's font on album cover - ITC Bookman Swash {Dav}
content:
This is a familiar font, the closest thing I have is ‘royalacid’ based on the masthead font from Rollingstone magazine. Can someone help identify it for me? It reminds me of all the sweet TV shows I watched as a kid like “Hart to Hart”. Who can forget Mrs. H, she really was Gorgeous.

Funnily enough there is another version of this album cover widely released which has really poor typography. Not sure why?

Cheers,

Dom

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Felt.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=Felt.jpg) | 48.82 KB |
| [252430.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=252430.jpg) | 9.61 KB |
author: Dominic Forde

comments.content:
Thanks Dav, much appreciated.

All the best,

Dom
BTW This is the ITC version, available from [Fonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126082308/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/mondosearchresults.htm?st=12&kid=bookman%20swash).
Actually, while the lowercase are all ITC Bookman, the caps and cap/lowercase ligatures are from the old pre-ITC Bookman Bold Italic.
